main event: On 6 October 1957, a civilian driving a car in Kremmling, Colorado, reported a 'found object' in the sky the size of a quarter, which later changed to a 'bell with a white cone' and then faded out over a 5-minute observation period.
interesting points: The shape of the object was described as a quarter and then changed to a bell with a white cone before fading out.
The object was first seen as a 'red ATV' before the change in appearance.
The observation was made by a civilian driving a car, with the object being stationary and gradually fading out.
The report indicates the possibility of the object being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature, but also classifies it as unknown.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were described as scattered clouds drifting east with good visibility.
sighted object: found object initially described as a quarter and then changed to a bell with a white cone
